title: 107_hr4155
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Legislative Autonomy Act of 2002" eliminates congressional review of newly-passed District laws. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended by eliminating congressional review of newly-passed District laws. Section 602 and section 604 are struck, and the exercise of rulemaking power is enacted by Congress. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended by eliminating congressional review of newly-passed District laws, specifically by striking the item relating to section 604. This subsection and its amendments are enacted by Congress as an exercise of the rulemaking power of the House of Representatives and the Senate, superseding other rules to the extent of inconsistency. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to eliminate congressional review of newly-passed District laws. The rules of each House shall supersede other rules to the extent of inconsistency, with recognition of the constitutional right of either House to change such rules at any time. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended by striking certain subsections and provisions, including section 303, 404(e), and 462. Section 404(e) is amended by removing references to section 602(c). Section 462 is amended by removing subsections (b) and (c). Section 472(d) is amended regarding payments not subject to appropriation. Section 472(d) and Section 475(e) of the D.C. Official Code are amended to specify that certain payments made by the District are not subject to appropriation. The District amends Section 475(e) to exclude certain payments from requiring appropriation for revenue anticipation notes. The District amends Section 475(e) to exclude certain payments for revenue anticipation notes. Amendments are made to Section 2(b)(1) and Section 5 of Amendment No. 1 related to initiative and referendum in the District Charter. Amendments are made to various sections of the D.C. Official Code and the District of Columbia Election Code of 1955. Amendments are made to subsections (j)(2) and (m) of the District of Columbia Election Code of 1955. This includes changes such as striking certain sections and sentences, and modifying language regarding the appropriate custodian and the holding of elections. Amendments are made to subsection (m) of the District of Columbia Election Code of 1955, including striking certain sections and sentences related to the appropriate custodian and holding of elections. The amendments made by this Act apply to acts of the District of Columbia passed on or after October 1, 2002, including those signed by the Mayor, vetoed and repassed by the Council, allowed to become effective without the Mayor's signature, or ratified by a majority of voters.
